title: Rahyaft Office / NOIR Office
description: RAHYAFT Central Office Approach is a knowledge-based architectural concept that aims to challenge conventional notions of office space. It envisions a dynamic environment where workspaces are integrated with collective areas, pause zones, and circulation paths, creating a vibrant and interactive building in which daily activities are not dictated solely by the traditional office program.

title: This 1970s Home Gets a Family-Friendly Makeover
description: In Calgary’s quiet residential landscape, a dated 1970s bungalow has been thoughtfully transformed into a warm, family-first home by Mera Studio Architects. With just 1,700 square feet, the design embraces curves, storage solutions, and playful moments, proving that even modest footprints can feel elevated, functional, and full of life. The clients, a young family, were already design-aligned with the studio through previous collaborations, and this shared language led to a renovation that balances minimalism with charm.
author: Erin

title: From Old Victorian Shopfront to Sustainable City Home with Solar Panels and Rooftop Garden
description: In the heart of a heritage conservation zone, CplusC Architects + Builders have reimagined the urban home as a living system. Welcome to the Jungle House is built on the belief that architecture must move beyond shelter and aesthetics, it must support life, reduce consumption, and regenerate the environment it inhabits.
author: Erin

title: A Maui Home Blends Modern Minimalism With Climate-Conscious Design
description: A compact home in Maui by Hawaii Off Grid blends modern minimalism with climate-conscious design, featuring a sculptural roof and timber construction.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: HOCH & CHHO Transform a Former Hotel Into a Bold Tourist Residence
description: A former hotel in Paris' Montmartre is reimagined into bold tourist rentals by HOCH & CHHO with a postmodern and pop-laced sensibility.
